CO36/25 SRM COMPANY NOTAM ATTENTION ALL FLIGHT CREWS, PLEASE BE ADVISED THAT WE ARE CURRENTLY EXPERIENCING SOME DIFFICULTIES AND IRREGULARITIES IN THE MANEUVERING OF AIRCRAFT AT THE NEWLY OPENED TERMINAL 2 PARKING POSITIONS. UNFORTUNATELY, THE PUBLISHED CHARTS AND ACTUAL PHYSICAL CONDITIONS ARE NOT 100% COMPATIBLE. THESE ISSUES MAY AFFECT TAXI-IN AND PUSHBACK OPERATIONS, AND WE KINDLY ASK FOR YOUR HEIGHTENED AWARENESS AND CAUTION WHEN OPERATING IN THESE AREAS. WE ARE ACTIVELY WORKING WITH GROUND OPERATIONS AND AIRPORT AUTHORITIES TO RESOLVE THESE ISSUES AND IMPROVE MARKINGS, SIGNAGE, AND GUIDANCE SYSTEMS WHERE NECESSARY.IN THE MEANTIME, PLEASE ENSURE: -STRICT ADHERENCE TO ATC INSTRUCTIONS, GROUND MARSHAL SIGNALS AND PARKING GUIDELINES. -USE OF MINIMUM SAFE TAXI SPEEDS. -IN CASE OF ANY HESITATION, STOP IMMEDIATELY AND INFORM THE GROUND FREQUENCY OF THE INCORRECT PARKING AND REQUEST TOWING, IF NEEDED.

LOCAL PRE-TRIAL A-CDM OPERATIONAL PROCEDURES ARE IN FORCE AT AIRPORT. -GROUND HANDLER (GH) ARE TO REPORT AND UPDATE TOBT (TARGET OFF- BLOCK TIME). -TSAT (TARGET START-UP APPROVAL TIME) WILL BE COMMUNICATED TO AIRSPACE USER BY GROUND HANDLER (GH). -WHERE A-VDGS (ADVANCED VISUAL DOCKING GUIDANCE SYSTEM) IS AVAILABLE TOBT AND TSAT WILL BE DISPLAYED. -THE PILOT SHALL REQUEST AN UPDATE TO THE TOBT FROM THE GROUND HANDLER (GH) IF THE TOBT CANNOT BE MET AT ANY MOMENT. -THE PILOT SHALL ENSURE THAT THE AIRCRAFT WILL BE READY FOR START UP CLEARANCE AND WILL HAVE CONTACT ON THE DELIVERY FREQUENCY WITHIN THE TSAT WINDOW (+/-5 MINS). -DEPARTURE CLEARANCE (EXCEPT SQUAWK) SHALL BE AVAILABLE 18 MINUTES BEFORE EOBT OR LATER. - THE PILOT SHALL CONTACT GROUND CONTROL FOR PUSH BACK OR TAXI WITHIN 5 MIN FROM OBTAINING START UP CLEARANCE (ASAT). - IF NO PUSH BACK OR TAXI REQUESTED AT ASAT+5, TSAT WILL EXPIRE, AND A NEW TOBT WILL BE REQUIRED FOR THE FLIGHT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE DEPARTURE SEQUENCE AND RECEIVE A NEW TSAT. -PUSH AND HOLD PROCEDURES WILL BE USED TO AVOID HOLDING ARRIVING AIRCRAFT IN CASE OF OCCUPIED STANDS.

ADS-B DATA FOR ECRA (EUROPEAN CONNECTED REGIONAL AIRPORTS PROGRAMME) OPERATIONS. 1.1.IN ORDER TO COOPERATE WITH ADS-B RECEIVER USED BY AIRPORT OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL FOR USE OF THE ECRA PROGRAMME AT EINDHOVEN AIRPORT,PILOTS OF MODE S EQUIPPED ACFT WITH ADS-B FUNCTIONALITIES WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND SHALL: A)SELECT AUTO MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE OR B)IF AUTOMODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON (E.G.XPDR) AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE. -FROM THE REQUEST FOR TOWER PUSH-BACK OR TAXI,WHICHEVER IS EARLIER -AFTER LANDING,CONTINUOUSLY UNTIL THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED IN ITS STAND. -WHEN THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED, FLT CREW SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2.WHENEVER THE ACFT IS CAPABLE OF REPORTING ACFT IDENTIFICATION (I.E.CALLSIGN USED IN FLT), THIS SHOULD BE ENTERED (THROUGH THE FMS OR THE TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE REQUEST FOR TOWED PUSH-BACK OR TAXI, WHICHEVER IS EARLIER. 1.1.3.AIR CREW MUST USE THE ICAO DEFINED FORMAT TO ENTER THE ACFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4.TO ENSURE THAT THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQ (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS) IS NOT COMPROMISED, TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RWY.

CO1082/22 COMPANY NOTAM ATTN TO ALL CREW FLYING INTO EINDHOVEN
NETHERLANDS MILITARY ATC IS EXPERIENCING ISSUES WITH ITS COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEM, THIS HAS LED TO A SHORT PERIOD IN WHICH COMMUNICATIONS FAILED COMPLETELY. HOWEVER WITH THE CURRENT STATUS OF THE SYSTEM THEY CANNOT GUARANTEE ITS AVAILABILITY 100% OF THE TIME AND IT MAY HAPPEN TO FAIL WITHOUT NOTICE.
IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT THIS PROBLEM CAN ONLY HINDER RADAR CONTROLLERS. THIS MEANS IN CASE OF A FAILURE THE COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEMS OF EINDHOVEN TOWER WILL REMAIN OPERATIONAL.
ALL AIRCRAFT ARE EXPECTED TO FLY THE ARRIVAL PROCEDURE THEY HAVE BEEN ASSIGNED, AS WELL AS CONTACT EINDHOVEN TOWER.
IN CASE THE AIRCRAFT HAS NOT YET BEEN ASSIGNED AN ARRIVAL PROCEDURE WHEN THE SYSTEM FAILS RETURN TO THE LAST RADAR SERVICE AND EXPECT TO DIVERT TO YOUR ALTERNATE.
121.500 SHOULD BE MONITORED AS THIS CHANNEL MAY BE USED TO INFORM ALL AIRCRAFT OF A TOTAL COMMUNICATIONS FAILURE.

AX0002/24 AIC RESTRICTION SUBJECT: REINFORCING THE FPL ADHERENCE CAMPAIGN VALIDITY:22MAY24-UFN TO AVOID UNFORESEEN TRAFFIC OVERLOAD OF ATC SECTORS IN EUROPE THE EUROCONTROL NETWORK MANAGER STRONGLY EXPECTS ALL IFR FLIGHTS THAT THEY WILL ACTUALLY BE OPERATED AT THE CRUISING ALTITUDE FILED IN THEIR FLIGHT PLAN. INFLIGHT CHANGE IN REQUESTED FLIGHT LEVELS SHOULD BE AVOIDED. BASED ON THE RECENT EXPERIENCES IN BUDAPEST FIR SOME IFR FLIGHTS (PARTICULARLY DEPARTING AND ARRIVING FROM/TO LHBP) ARE OBSERVED PLANNING THEIR FLIGHTS AT LOW CRUISING ALTITUDES (BELOW 9500 FEET) TO AVOID TRAFFIC RESTRICTIONS IMPOSED ON THE LOWER ACC SECTORS IN BUDAPEST CTA. HUNGAROCONTROL DRAWS THE ATTENTION OF OPERATORS PERFORMING SUCH FLIGHTS WITHIN BUDAPEST FIR TO THE FOLLOWING: - HUNGAROCONTROL CONSIDERS THESE FLIGHTS BEING PLANNED INTENTIONALLY IN UNCONTROLLED AIRSPACE CONSEQUENTLY THEY WILL BE EXPECTED TO OPERATE AT THE REQUESTED ALTITUDE FOR THE GIVEN SECTION OF THE ROUTE FILED IN THEIR FLIGHT PLANS. - EXCEPT IN AN EMERGENCY, FOR IFR FLIGHTS INTENTIONALLY OPERATING IN UNCONTROLLED AIRSPACE ATC CANNOT GUARANTEE THE ENTRY INTO CONTROLLED AIRSPACE BY APPROVING A CHANGE IN THEIR REQUESTED FLIGHT LEVEL (ESPECIALLY,IF TRAFFIC RESTRICTIONS ARE IN FORCE IN THE ATC SECTORS CONCERNED). - FLIGHTS WITH CRUISING ALTITUDES BELOW 9500 FEET - OUTSIDE OF TMAS AND CTRS - WILL OPERATE IN UNCONTROLLED AIRSPACE (ICAO CLASS G), IN WHICH TRAFFIC UNKNOWN TO THE APPROPRIATE ATS UNIT CAN BE OPERATING, WHERE THE RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE PREVENTION OF COLLISION SOLELY RELIES ON THE AIR CREWS.

SX0060/22 AIP SUPPLEMENT EBBU/FIR - RESTRICTIONS RELATED TO THE RUSSIAN INVASION OF UKRAINE - 08SEP22-UFN 1 AVOIDANCE OF OPERATIONS IN THE CRISIS AREA BELGIAN AIR OPERATORS AND OWNERS OF AIRCRAFT REGISTERED IN BELGIUM SHALL NOT ENTER UKBU, UKLV, UKBV, UKDV, UKFV, UKOV, URRV. FLIGHT OPERATIONS SHALL ALSO BE AVOIDED WITHIN THE BUFFER ZONE EXTENDING OUT TO 200 NM ALONG THE UKRAINE/RUSSIA BORDER. OPERATIONS WITHIN LUUU SHALL ONLY BE UNDERTAKEN IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE APPLICABLE AERONAUTICAL PUBLICATIONS ISSUED BY THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA. ADDITIONAL RISK ASSESSMENT AND FLIGHT PLANNING DECISIONS SHALL BE TAKEN BEFORE OPERATING UUWV. 2 RESTRICTIONS FOR RUSSIAN OPERATORS LL RUSSIAN REGISTERED AIRCRAFT AND AIRCRAFT OWNED, CHARTERED OR OPERATED, OR OTHERWISE CONTROLLED BY NATURAL OR LEGAL PERSONS FROM THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION OR BY OPERATORS HOLDING AN AIR OPERATOR CERTIFICATE (AOC) ISSUED BY THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION AUTHORITIES ARE PROHIBITED TO ENTER, EXIT OR OVERFLY BELGIAN AND LUXEMBOURGISH AIRSPACE, EXCEPT FOR HUMANITARIAN, SAR AND LEASED AIRCRAFT ONE-WAY RETURN FLIGHTS WITH THE PERMISSION OF THE APPROPRIATE BELGIAN OR LUXEMBOURGISH AUTHORITIES AND IN CASE OF EMERGENCY LANDING OR EMERGENCY OVERFLIGHT.
WHEN EXPERIENCING REDUCED RADIO COVERAGE IN NORTH SEA AREA AMSTERDAM SOUTH ON AMSTERDAM INFORMATION FREQ. 128.500 MHZ, REVERT TO 124.300 MHZ.

Paragraph.Text: AX0008/24 AIC RESTRICTION EDDB/BERLIN/BRANDENBURG HANDLING OF ARR AND DEP AT AD VALIDITY: 03OCT24-UFN 1. DEP FM BERLIN BRANDENBURG AP 1.1 ASSIGNMENT OF THE TKOF RWY THE ASSIGNMENT OF THE RWY FOR TKOF IS BASED ON THE FLW CONSIDERATIONS: DEP FM THE ACFT STANDS ON APN 1, 2, 2A, 3, 3A, 3B, 4, A AND E AND THE ACFT STANDS B01 TO B04 AND D01 TO D07 WILL ALWAYS BE ASSIGNED RWY 06L/24R. ALL OTHER DEP WILL ALWAYS BE ASSIGNED RWY 06R/24L. 1.2 USE OF DEP RTE FOR TKOF FM RWY 06L AND 06R, CIRCUMSTANCES REQUIRE AN INCREASED CLIMB GRADIENT (PROC DESIGN GRADIENT, PDG) TO BE MNTN ON THE NOISE-OPTIMISED DEP RTE. DUE TO THE HIGH NOISE SENSITIVITY, ALL FLT THAT CAN COMPLY WITH THESE GRADIENTS MUST, PLAN THE FLW DEP RTE: DEP FM RWY 06L ON DEP RTE IN THE DIRECTION OF SUKIP OR LOGDO WILL USE RTE WITH THE ID B. DEP FM RWY 06R ON DEP RTE IN THE DIRECTION OF SUKIP OR LOGDO WILL USE RTE WITH THE ID Q. CK PRIOR DEP NECESSARILY THE COMPLIANCE WITH THE RESTRICTION AT POBAM (F100+). IF UNA ADZ ATC PRIOR DEP IN DUE TIME. DEP FM RWY 06R ON DEP RTE IN THE DIRECTION OF GERGA, ARSAP OR LUROS WILL USE RTE WITH THE ID Q. IF, FOR AERODYNAMIC OR MET REASONS, AN ACFT PILOT IS UNA TO FULFIL THE CLIMB GRADIENT SPECIFIED IN THE DEP RTE, THIS SHALL BE COMMUNICATED AT THE START-UP APPROVAL. ONLY IN SUCH CASES DFS WILL THEN GIVE THE CLR FOR THE ALTERNATIVE DEP RTE. 1.3 INDEPENDENT DEP OPS USUALLY, TKOF FM BOTH PARL RWY TAKE PLACE INDEPENDENTLY OF EACH OTHER. CARE MUST BE TAKEN TO COMPLY WITH THE PROC EXACTLY. ANY DEVIATIONS, ESPECIALLY IN THE DIRECTION OF THE PARL RWY, MUST BE AVOIDED AT ALL COSTS. THIS ALSO APPLIES TO DEVIATIONS DUE TO MET REASONS, WHICH MAY ONLY TAKE PLACE AFT CONSULTATION WITH ATC. 2. APCH TO BERLIN BRANDENBURG AP 2.1 ASSIGNMENT OF LDG RWY THE ASSIGNMENT OF THE RWY FOR THE APCH IS BASED ON THE FLW CONSIDERATIONS: APCH FM THE ACFT STANDS ON APN 1, 2, 2A, 3, 3A, 3B, 4, A AND E AND THE ACFT STANDS B01 TO B04 AND D01 TO D07 WILL ALWAYS BE ASSIGNED RWY 06L/24R. ALL OTHER APCH WILL ALWAYS BE ASSIGNED RWY 06R/24L. DEPENDING ON THE TFC SITUATION, DEVIATIONS FM THIS DISTRIBUTION ARE POSS, ESPECIALLY IN TERMS OF LOAD BALANCING. 2.2 CHANGING FREQ TO BERLIN DIRECTOR WHEN CHANGING FREQUENCIES FM BREMEN RADAR TO BERLIN DIRECTOR, THE INITIAL CALL SHALL BE RESTRICTED TO THE CALL SIGN TO AVOID FREQ CONGESTION. 2.3 INDEPENDENT APCH OPS AS A RULE, APCH WILL BE PERFORMED IN INDEPENDENT PARL APCH OPS. THIS WILL BE ANNOUNCED THRU THE ATIS ON THE FREQ 123.780 MHZ.
